fr.sorbonne_u.cps.asynpcalc.interfaces

Interface AsynchronousParallelCalculatorServicesCI

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AsynchronousCalculatorServicesCI, fr.sorbonne_u.components.interfaces.ComponentInterface, fr.sorbonne_u.components.interfaces.OfferedCI, java.rmi.Remote, fr.sorbonne_u.components.interfaces.RequiredCI
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AsynchronousParallelCalculatorServicesConnector, AsynchronousParallelCalculatorServicesInboundPort, AsynchronousParallelCalculatorServicesOutboundPort

    public interface AsynchronousParallelCalculatorServicesCI
extends AsynchronousCalculatorServicesCI
    The component interface AsynchronousParallelCalculatorServicesCI defines the signatures of parallel vector computation services.

    Description

    Invariants

     invariant       true

    Created on : 2020-05-28

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void parallelAdditions(double[] xs, double[] ys, long[] serialNo, java.lang.String resultReceptionInboundPortURI)
      add each of the first operands with each of the second and return the results one by one, as soon as they become available, by calling a port offering the interface ResultReceptionCI which URI is given as the last parameter; the serial numbers allow the caller to identify its each of the results when receiving them.
      void parallelSubtractions(double[] xs, double[] ys, long[] serialNo, java.lang.String resultReceptionInboundPortURI)
      subtract each of the first operands with each of the second and return the results one by one, as soon as they become available, by calling a port offering the interface ResultReceptionCI which URI is given as the last parameter; the serial numbers allow the caller to identify its each of the results when receiving them.

      • Methods inherited from interface fr.sorbonne_u.cps.asyncalc.interfaces.AsynchronousCalculatorServicesCI

        addition, subtraction

    • Method Detail

      • parallelAdditions

        void parallelAdditions(double[] xs,
                       double[] ys,
                       long[] serialNo,
                       java.lang.String resultReceptionInboundPortURI)
                throws java.lang.Exception
        add each of the first operands with each of the second and return the results one by one, as soon as they become available, by calling a port offering the interface ResultReceptionCI which URI is given as the last parameter; the serial numbers allow the caller to identify its each of the results when receiving them.

        Contract

         pre     xs != null && ys != null && xs.length == ys.length
 pre     serialNo != null && xs.length == serialNo.length
 pre     resultReceptionInboundPortURI != null && !resultReceptionInboundPortURI.isEmpty()
 post    true        // no postcondition.
        Parameters:
        xs - array of first operands.
        ys - array of second operands.
        serialNo - array of serial numbers for each result.
        resultReceptionInboundPortURI - URI of the port offering the interface ResultReceptionCI to return the result.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - to do.

      • parallelSubtractions

        void parallelSubtractions(double[] xs,
                          double[] ys,
                          long[] serialNo,
                          java.lang.String resultReceptionInboundPortURI)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        subtract each of the first operands with each of the second and return the results one by one, as soon as they become available, by calling a port offering the interface ResultReceptionCI which URI is given as the last parameter; the serial numbers allow the caller to identify its each of the results when receiving them.

        Contract

         pre     xs != null && ys != null && xs.length == ys.length
 pre     serialNo != null && xs.length == serialNo.length
 pre     resultReceptionInboundPortURI != null && !resultReceptionInboundPortURI.isEmpty()
 post    true        // no postcondition.
        Parameters:
        xs - array of first operands.
        ys - array of second operands.
        serialNo - array of serial numbers for each result.
        resultReceptionInboundPortURI - URI of the port offering the interface ResultReceptionCI to return the result.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - to do.
